title: Bug 3666: Code Completion Hungry code assist (1GDRYW5)
description:
Bug 3666: Code Completion Hungry code assist (1GDRYW5)

Under certain circumstances code assist eats too much code.

Consider the enclosed class.

As a programmer, I must add a parameter to the baz call in bar to make the program correct.

Steps:
1. UI can decide whether it wants to use the code assist end position (until the end of current identifier) or the cursor location it used to start with, so as to control the amount of source to replace.
Removing code assist option.
OB: Under certain circumstances, the code assist feature in the software consumes excessive code. The bug is observed in the provided class.
EB:
The code should be changed to:

baz(x.foo().foo())

Instead of:

baz(x.foo())

This change will make the program correct.
SR:
To reproduce the bug:
1. Open the provided class.
2. Locate the method 'bar'.
3. Change the baz call in 'bar' from 'baz(x.foo())' to 'baz(x.foo().foo())'.
